title: Considering C99 for curl
Tell LOBSTER: Upwork's a scam. Can build a webapp for you, assemble team if needed. Complexity: ANY
description:
Hi Lobster. Please don’t flag this post, because I’m very very upset with Upwork.com and I’m not sure what’s the best approach here. I don’t want to be negative towards them directly, but instead contribute something positive to others.

I’m a software engineer with 21+ years of experience in software engineering. Been a senior software engineer, team lead, technical project manager, CTO and even a devops engineer. Can do anything from scratch and hit the deadlines, for the most part.

I tried Upwork and sending resumes to job openings: over 150 proposals sent over 2 weeks actually - none worked, which makes me think Upwork is an outright scam. Or am I missing something?

My stack is pretty diverse and my experience is vast. I have a lot of time on my hands too - about 12 to 14 a day + weekends.

If you’d like to have a project built fast and reliably (frameworks, no frameworks, micro-services, CGI or whatnot – or you have no preference and just want things done the best way possible) – please don’t hesitate to contact me and describe the details of your project [and your company]. My rates are pretty standard and can be lower if I’m allowed to use parts of the stack I particularly enjoy working with (if you don’t know or care about that, I will surely let you know and give you a discount). I can start NOW - like literally now - and commit to short-, medium- or long term.

I’m located in Vancouver, BC, but I frequently visit Asia (I’m not Asian, folks, but I like it there) and I’m also pretty versatile when it comes to time-zones. Don’t have much of a personal life, so can work nights - in fact I prefer that.

You shall be able to find my email in my profile. Drop me a line with a few words about yourself and your project. If it sounds like a match, I’ll send you back all the necessary information including my resume, Github & Gitlab accounts, answers to relevant questions you might have, etc. You may also ask additional questions here: I’ll answer publicly if I deem this appropriate.

ON A RELATED NOTE: If you happen to be a seed-round investor, I have a stellar idea, HOWEVER I’m accumulating for that seed round myself - don’t like investors much (nothing personal). But there’s a slight chance we might hit it off – if you and I are both interested in collaborating on it, we can discuss it, no NDA necessary. The idea is somewhat validated and has a marketing plan, as well as me as a software development team and my friend, who is wonderful young woman with a true grit of a honey-badger (nothing crypto-related, not to worry)

Thank you.
description_plain:
Hi Lobster. *Please don't flag this post, because I'm very very upset with Upwork.com and I'm not sure what's the best approach here. I don't want to be negative towards them directly, but instead contribute something positive to others.*

I'm a software engineer with 21+ years of experience in software engineering. Been a senior software engineer, team lead, technical project manager, CTO and even a devops engineer. Can do anything from scratch and hit the deadlines, for the most part.

I tried Upwork and sending resumes to job openings: over 150 proposals sent over 2 weeks actually - none worked, which makes me think Upwork is an outright scam. Or am I missing something?

My stack is pretty diverse and my experience is vast. I have a lot of time on my hands too - about 12 to 14 a day + weekends.

*If you'd like to have a project built fast and reliably* (frameworks, no frameworks, micro-services, CGI or whatnot -- or you have no preference and just want things done the best way possible) -- please don't hesitate to contact me and describe the details of your project [and your company]. My rates are pretty standard and can be lower if I'm allowed to use parts of the stack I particularly enjoy working with (if you don't know or care about that, I will surely let you know and give you a discount). I can start NOW - like literally now - and commit to short-, medium- or long term.

I'm located in Vancouver, BC, but I frequently visit Asia (I'm not Asian, folks, but I like it there) and I'm also pretty versatile when it comes to time-zones. Don't have much of a personal life, so can work nights - in fact I prefer that.

You shall be able to find my email in my profile. Drop me a line with a few words about yourself and your project. If it sounds like a match, I'll send you back all the necessary information including my resume, Github & Gitlab accounts, answers to relevant questions you might have, etc. You may also ask additional questions here: I'll answer publicly if I deem this appropriate.

ON A RELATED NOTE: *If you happen to be a seed-round investor, I have a stellar idea, HOWEVER I'm accumulating for that seed round myself - don't like investors much (nothing personal). But there's a slight chance we might hit it off -- if you and I are both interested in collaborating on it, we can discuss it, no NDA necessary. The idea is somewhat validated and has a marketing plan, as well as me as a software development team and my friend, who is wonderful young woman with a true grit of a honey-badger (nothing crypto-related, not to worry)*

Thank you.

These days I work on a Linux desktop but use an M1 Mac Mini at home.

title: Infosys leaked FullAdminAccess AWS keys on PyPi for over a year
description:
“To put it bluntly, I’m not sure I trusted Infosys to revoke this key in a timely manner. So I did it for them with aws iam delete-access-key –access-key-id=$AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, and now the key is useless”

= gold
